I will shout for joy as I play for you;
I will speak of your righteousness all day long,

72.verse_text: Teach the king to judge with your righteousness, O God; share with him your own justice, and govern the oppressed with righteousness. may it experience righteousness. may he help the needy and defeat their oppressors. as long as the moon gives light, for ages to come. like showers falling on the land. and may prosperity last as long as the moon gives light. from the Euphrates to the ends of the earth. his enemies will throw themselves to the ground. all nations will serve him. and those who are needy and neglected. he saves the lives of those in need. their lives are precious to him. may prayers be said for him at all times; may God's blessings be on him always! may the hills be covered with crops, as fruitful as those of Lebanon. May the cities be filled with people, like fields full of grass. may his fame last as long as the sun. May all nations ask God to bless them He alone does these wonderful things. May his glory fill the whole world. Amen! Amen!
so that he will rule over your people with justice
May the land enjoy prosperity;
May the king judge the poor fairly;
May your people worship you as long as the sun shines,
May the king be like rain on the fields,
May righteousness flourish in his lifetime,
His kingdom will reach from sea to sea,
The peoples of the desert will bow down before him;
The kings of Spain and of the islands will offer him gifts; the kings of Sheba and Seba will bring him offerings. May he be given gold from Sheba; as he has blessed the king.
All kings will bow down before him;
He rescues the poor who call to him,
He has pity on the weak and poor;
He rescues them from oppression and violence;
Long live the king!
May there be plenty of grain in the land;
May the king's name never be forgotten;
Praise the Lord , the God of Israel!
Praise his glorious name forever!
This is the end of the prayers of David son of Jesse.

73.verse_text: God is indeed good to Israel, to those who have pure hearts. my faith was almost gone when I saw that things go well for the wicked. they are strong and healthy. they do not have the troubles that others have. and violence like a robe; and their minds are busy with wicked schemes. they are proud and make plans to oppress others. and give arrogant orders to everyone on earth, the Most High will not find out.” They have plenty and are always getting more. and have not committed sin? every morning you have punished me. I would not be acting as one of your people. but it was too difficult for me Then I understood what will happen to the wicked. and make them fall to destruction! they go down to a horrible end. when you rouse yourself, O Lord, they disappear. and my feelings were hurt, I did not understand you. and you hold me by the hand. and at the end you will receive me with honor. Since I have you, what else could I want on earth? but God is my strength; he is all I ever need. you will destroy those who are unfaithful to you. to find protection with the Sovereign Lord and to proclaim all that he has done!
But I had nearly lost confidence;
because I was jealous of the proud
They do not suffer pain;
They do not suffer as other people do;
And so they wear pride like a necklace
their hearts pour out evil,
They laugh at other people and speak of evil things;
They speak evil of God in heaven
so that even God's people turn to them and eagerly believe whatever they say.
They say, “God will not know;
That is what the wicked are like.
Is it for nothing, then, that I have kept myself pure
O God, you have made me suffer all day long;
If I had said such things,
I tried to think this problem through,
until I went into your Temple.
You will put them in slippery places
They are instantly destroyed;
They are like a dream that goes away in the morning;
When my thoughts were bitter
I was as stupid as an animal;
Yet I always stay close to you,
You guide me with your instruction
What else do I have in heaven but you?
My mind and my body may grow weak,
Those who abandon you will certainly perish;
But as for me, how wonderful to be near God,

74.verse_text: Why have you abandoned us like this, O God? Will you be angry with your own people forever? whom you brought out of slavery to be your own tribe. Remember Mount Zion, where once you lived. our enemies have destroyed everything in the Temple. they have placed their flags there as signs of victory. with their axes and sledge hammers. they desecrated the place where you are worshiped. they burned down every holy place in the land. there are no prophets left, and no one knows how long this will last. Will they insult your name forever? you have saved us many times. and smashed the heads of the sea monsters; you dried up large rivers. you set the sun and the moon in their places; you made summer and winter. that they are godless and despise you. don't forget your persecuted people! There is violence in every dark corner of the land. let those poor and needy people praise you. Remember that godless people laugh at you all day long. the continuous noise made by your foes.
Remember your people, whom you chose for yourself long ago,
Walk over these total ruins;
Your enemies have shouted in triumph in your Temple;
They looked like woodsmen cutting down trees with their axes. Why do you keep your hands behind you? and fed his body to desert animals.
They smashed all the wooden panels
They wrecked your Temple and set it on fire;
They wanted to crush us completely;
All our sacred symbols are gone;
How long, O God, will our enemies laugh at you?
Why have you refused to help us?
But you have been our king from the beginning, O God;
With your mighty strength you divided the sea
you crushed the heads of the monster Leviathan
You made springs and fountains flow;
You created the day and the night;
you set the limits of the earth;
But remember, O Lord , that your enemies laugh at you,
Don't abandon your helpless people to their cruel enemies;
Remember the covenant you made with us.
Don't let the oppressed be put to shame;
Rouse yourself, God, and defend your cause!
Don't forget the angry shouts of your enemies,

75.verse_text: We give thanks to you, O God, we give thanks to you! We proclaim how great you are “and I will judge with fairness. and the earth itself be shaken, I will keep its foundations firm. condemning some and acquitting others. filled with the strong wine of his anger. He pours it out, and all the wicked drink it; they drink it down to the last drop. or singing praises to him. but the power of the righteous will be increased. and tell of the wonderful things you have done. from the north or from the south;
“I have set a time for judgment,” says God,
I tell the wicked not to be arrogant;
I tell them to stop their boasting.”
Judgment does not come from the east or from the west,
it is God who is the judge,
The Lord holds a cup in his hand,
But I will never stop speaking of the God of Jacob
He will break the power of the wicked,

76.verse_text: God is known in Judah; his name is honored in Israel. he lives on Mount Zion. their shields and swords, yes, all their weapons. How majestic, as you return from the mountains where you defeated your foes. and now are sleeping the sleep of death; all their strength and skill was useless. the horses and their riders fell dead. No one can stand in your presence when you are angry. the world was afraid and kept silent, to save all the oppressed on earth. bring gifts to him, all you nearby nations. God makes everyone fear him; and terrifies great kings.
He has his home in Jerusalem;
There he broke the arrows of the enemy,
How glorious you are, O God!
Their brave soldiers have been stripped of all they had
When you threatened them, O God of Jacob,
But you, Lord , are feared by all.
You made your judgment known from heaven;
when you rose up to pronounce judgment,
Human anger only results in more praise for you; those who survive the wars will keep your festivals.
Give the Lord your God what you promised him;

77.verse_text: I cry aloud to God; I cry aloud, and he hears me. all night long I lift my hands in prayer, but I cannot find comfort. when I meditate, I feel discouraged. I am so worried that I cannot speak. and remember years of long ago. I meditate, and this is what I ask myself: Will he never again be pleased with us? Does his promise no longer stand? Has anger taken the place of his compassion?” I will recall the wonders you did in the past. I will meditate on all your mighty acts. No god is as great as you. you showed your might among the nations. the descendants of Jacob and of Joseph. and the depths of the sea trembled. thunder crashed from the sky, and lightning flashed in all directions. and flashes of lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook. you crossed the deep sea, but your footprints could not be seen. with Moses and Aaron in charge.
In times of trouble I pray to the Lord;
When I think of God, I sigh;
He keeps me awake all night;
I think of days gone by
I spend the night in deep thought;
“Will the Lord always reject us?
Has he stopped loving us?
Has God forgotten to be merciful?
Then I said, “What hurts me most is this— that God is no longer powerful.”
I will remember your great deeds, Lord ;
I will think about all that you have done;
Everything you do, O God, is holy.
You are the God who works miracles;
By your power you saved your people,
When the waters saw you, O God, they were afraid,
The clouds poured down rain;
The crash of your thunder rolled out,
You walked through the waves;
You led your people like a shepherd,

78.verse_text: Listen, my people, to my teaching, and pay attention to what I say. and explain mysteries from the past, things that our ancestors told us. we will tell the next generation about the Lord 's power and his great deeds and the wonderful things he has done. and commandments to the descendants of Jacob. He instructed our ancestors to teach his laws to their children, and in turn should tell their children. and not forget what he has done, but always obey his commandments. a rebellious and disobedient people, whose trust in God was never firm and who did not remain faithful to him. ran away on the day of battle. they refused to obey his law. the miracles they had seen him perform. in the plain of Zoan in the land of Egypt. he made the waters stand like walls. and all night long with the light of a fire. and gave them water from the depths. and made water flow like a river. and in the desert they rebelled against the Most High. by demanding the food they wanted. “Can God supply food in the desert? and water flowed out in a torrent; but can he also provide us with bread and give his people meat?” he attacked his people with fire, and his anger against them grew, and did not believe that he would save them. and commanded its doors to open; by sending down manna for them to eat. and God gave them all they wanted. and by his power he stirred up the south wind; as many as the grains of sand on the shore; all around the tents. God gave them what they wanted. and were still eating, and killed their strongest men, the best young men of Israel. in spite of his miracles they did not trust him. and their lives with sudden disaster. the rest would turn to him; they would repent and pray earnestly to him. that the Almighty came to their aid. nothing they said was sincere. they were not faithful to their covenant with him. He forgave their sin and did not destroy them. Many times he held back his anger and restrained his fury. like a wind that blows by and is gone. how many times they made him sad! and brought pain to the Holy God of Israel. and the day when he saved them from their enemies in the plain of Zoan in the land of Egypt. and the Egyptians had no water to drink. and frogs that ruined their land. and to destroy their fields. and their fig trees with frost. by pouring out his anger and fierce rage, which came as messengers of death. or spare their lives, but killed them with a plague. of all the families of Egypt. and guided them through the desert. but the sea came rolling over their enemies. to the mountains which he himself conquered. he divided their land among the tribes of Israel and gave their homes to his people. and put him to the test. They did not obey his commandments, unreliable as a crooked arrow. and with their idols they made him furious. so he rejected his people completely. the home where he had lived among us. the symbol of his power and glory. and let them be killed by their enemies. and young women had no one to marry. and their widows were not allowed to mourn. he was like a strong man excited by wine. in lasting and shameful defeat. he did not select the tribe of Ephraim. and Mount Zion, which he dearly loves. like his home in heaven; he made it firm like the earth itself, secure for all time. he took him from the pastures, and he made him king of Israel, the shepherd of the people of God. and led them with skill.
I am going to use wise sayings
things we have heard and known,
We will not keep them from our children;
He gave laws to the people of Israel
so that the next generation might learn them
In this way they also will put their trust in God
They will not be like their ancestors,
The Ephraimites, armed with bows and arrows,
They did not keep their covenant with God;
They forgot what he had done,
While their ancestors watched, God performed miracles
He divided the sea and took them through it;
By day he led them with a cloud
He split rocks open in the desert
He caused a stream to come out of the rock
But they continued to sin against God,
They deliberately put God to the test
They spoke against God and said,
It is true that he struck the rock,
And so the Lord was angry when he heard them;
because they had no faith in him
But he spoke to the sky above
he gave them grain from heaven,
So they ate the food of angels,
He also caused the east wind to blow,
and to his people he sent down birds,
they fell in the middle of the camp
So the people ate and were satisfied;
But they had not yet satisfied their craving
when God became angry with them
In spite of all this the people kept sinning;
So he ended their days like a breath
Whenever he killed some of them,
They remembered that God was their protector,
But their words were all lies;
They were not loyal to him;
But God was merciful to his people.
He remembered that they were only mortal beings,
How often they rebelled against him in the desert;
Again and again they put God to the test
They forgot his great power
and performed his mighty acts and miracles
He turned the rivers into blood,
He sent flies among them, that tormented them,
He sent locusts to eat their crops
He killed their grapevines with hail
He killed their cattle with hail and their flocks with lightning.
He caused them great distress
He did not restrain his anger
He killed the first-born sons
Then he led his people out like a shepherd
He led them safely, and they were not afraid;
He brought them to his holy land,
He drove out the inhabitants as his people advanced;
But they rebelled against Almighty God
but were rebellious and disloyal like their ancestors,
They angered him with their heathen places of worship,
God was angry when he saw it,
He abandoned his tent in Shiloh,
He allowed our enemies to capture the Covenant Box,
He was angry with his own people
Young men were killed in war,
Priests died by violence,
At last the Lord woke up as though from sleep;
He drove his enemies back
But he rejected the descendants of Joseph;
Instead he chose the tribe of Judah
There he built his Temple
He chose his servant David;
where he looked after his flocks,
David took care of them with unselfish devotion

79.verse_text: O God, the heathen have invaded your land. They have desecrated your holy Temple and left Jerusalem in ruins. the bodies of your servants for wild animals to eat. blood flowed like water all through Jerusalem, and no one was left to bury the dead. they laugh at us and mock us. Will your anger continue to burn like fire? on the people who do not pray to you. they have ruined your country. Have mercy on us now; we have lost all hope. rescue us and forgive our sins for the sake of your own honor. “Where is your God?” Let us see you punish the nations for shedding the blood of your servants. and by your great power free those who are condemned to die. for all the insults they have hurled at you. will thank you forever and praise you for all time to come.
They left the bodies of your people for the vultures,
They shed your people's blood like water;
Lord , will you be angry with us forever?
Turn your anger on the nations that do not worship you,
For they have killed your people;
Do not punish us for the sins of our ancestors.
Help us, O God, and save us;
Why should the nations ask us,
Listen to the groans of the prisoners,
Lord, pay the other nations back seven times
Then we, your people, the sheep of your flock,

80.verse_text: Listen to us, O Shepherd of Israel; hear us, leader of your flock. Seated on your throne above the winged creatures, Show us your strength; come and save us! Show us your mercy, and we will be saved! will you be angry with your people's prayers? a large cup of tears to drink. our enemies insult us. Show us your mercy, and we will be saved! you drove out other nations and planted it in their land. its roots went deep, and it spread out over the whole land. its branches overshadowed the giant cedars. and as far as the Euphrates River. Now anyone passing by can steal its grapes; and wild animals feed on it. Look down from heaven at us; come and save your people! this young vine you made grow so strong! look at them in anger and destroy them! the nation you made so strong. keep us alive, and we will praise you. Show us your mercy, and we will be saved.
reveal yourself to the tribes of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh.
How much longer, Lord God Almighty,
You have given us sorrow to eat,
You let the surrounding nations fight over our land;
You brought a grapevine out of Egypt;
You cleared a place for it to grow;
It covered the hills with its shade;
It extended its branches to the Mediterranean Sea
Why did you break down the fences around it?
Come and save this grapevine that you planted,
Our enemies have set it on fire and cut it down;
Preserve and protect the people you have chosen,
We will never turn away from you again;
Bring us back, Lord God Almighty.

81.verse_text: Shout for joy to God our defender; sing praise to the God of Jacob! play pleasant music on the harps and the lyres. when the moon is new and when the moon is full. an order from the God of Jacob. when he attacked the land of Egypt. I hear an unknown voice saying, I let you put down your loads of bricks. From my hiding place in the storm, I answered you. I put you to the test at the springs of Meribah. Israel, how I wish you would listen to me! who brought you out of Egypt. Open your mouth, and I will feed you. Israel would not obey me. and do whatever they wanted. how I wish they would obey me! and conquer all their foes. their punishment would last forever. and satisfy you with wild honey.”
Start the music and beat the tambourines;
Blow the trumpet for the festival,
This is the law in Israel,
He gave it to the people of Israel
“I took the burdens off your backs;
When you were in trouble, you called to me, and I saved you.
Listen, my people, to my warning;
You must never worship another god.
I am the Lord your God,
“But my people would not listen to me;
So I let them go their stubborn ways
How I wish my people would listen to me;
I would quickly defeat their enemies
Those who hate me would bow in fear before me;
But I would feed you with the finest wheat

82.verse_text: God presides in the heavenly council; in the assembly of the gods he gives his decision: you must no longer be partial to the wicked! be fair to the needy and the helpless. You are completely corrupt, and justice has disappeared from the world. ‘all of you are children of the Most High.’ your life will end like that of any prince.” all the nations are yours.
Defend the rights of the poor and the orphans;
Rescue them from the power of evil people.
But you will die like mortals;
Come, O God, and rule the world;

83.verse_text: O God, do not keep silent; do not be still, do not be quiet! and those who hate you are rebelling. they are plotting against those you protect. so that Israel will be forgotten forever.” and form an alliance against you: the people of Moab and the Hagrites; and of Philistia and Tyre. as a strong ally of the Ammonites and Moabites, the descendants of Lot. and to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River. and their bodies rotted on the ground. defeat all their rulers as you did Zebah and Zalmunna, the land that belongs to God.” like straw blown away by the wind. as flames set the hills on fire, and terrify them with your fierce winds. and make them acknowledge your power. may they die in complete disgrace. supreme ruler over all the earth.
Look! Your enemies are in revolt,
They are making secret plans against your people;
“Come,” they say, “let us destroy their nation,
the people of Edom and the Ishmaelites;
the people of Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,
Do to them what you did to the Midianites,

who said, “We will take for our own
Scatter them like dust, O God,
chase them away with your storm
Cover their faces with shame, O Lord ,

May they know that you alone are the Lord ,

84.verse_text: How I love your Temple, Lord Almighty! I long to be in the Lord 's Temple. With my whole being I sing for joy to the living God. and the swallows have their own home; they keep their young near your altars, Lord Almighty, my king and my God. always singing praise to you. who are eager to make the pilgrimage to Mount Zion. it becomes a place of springs; the autumn rain fills it with pools. they will see the God of gods on Zion. Listen, O God of Jacob! the king you have chosen. is better than a thousand anywhere else; I would rather stand at the gate of the house of my God than live in the homes of the wicked. blessing us with kindness and honor. He does not refuse any good thing to those who do what is right.
How I want to be there!
Even the sparrows have built a nest,
How happy are those who live in your Temple,
How happy are those whose strength comes from you,
As they pass through the dry valley of Baca,
They grow stronger as they go;
Hear my prayer, Lord God Almighty.
One day spent in your Temple
The Lord is our protector and glorious king,
Lord Almighty, how happy are those who trust in you!

85.verse_text: Lord , you have been merciful to your land; you have made Israel prosperous again. and pardoned all their wrongs. and held back your furious rage. and stop being displeased with us! Will your anger never cease? and we, your people, will praise you. and give us your saving help. he promises peace to us, his own people, if we do not go back to our foolish ways. and his saving presence will remain in our land. righteousness and peace will embrace. and God's righteousness will look down from heaven. and our land will produce rich harvests. and prepare the path for him.
You have forgiven your people's sins
You stopped being angry with them
Bring us back, O God our savior,
Will you be angry with us forever?
Show us your constant love, O Lord ,
I am listening to what the Lord God is saying;
Surely he is ready to save those who honor him,
Human loyalty will reach up from the earth,
The Lord will make us prosperous,
Righteousness will go before the Lord

86.verse_text: Listen to me, Lord , and answer me, for I am helpless and weak. save me, for I am your servant and I trust in you. I pray to you all day long. because my prayers go up to you. full of constant love for all who pray to you. hear my cries for help. because you answer my prayers. not one has done what you have done. will come and bow down to you; they will praise your greatness. you alone are God. and I will obey you faithfully; teach me to serve you with complete devotion. I will proclaim your greatness forever. You have saved me from the grave itself. a cruel gang is trying to kill me— people who pay no attention to you. always patient, always kind and faithful. strengthen me and save me, because I serve you just as my mother did. those who hate me will be ashamed when they see that you have given me comfort and help.
Save me from death, because I am loyal to you;
You are my God, so be merciful to me;
Make your servant glad, O Lord,
You are good to us and forgiving,
I call to you in times of trouble,
There is no god like you, O Lord,
All the nations that you have created
You are mighty and do wonderful things;
Teach me, Lord , what you want me to do,
I will praise you with all my heart, O Lord my God;
How great is your constant love for me!
Proud people are coming against me, O God;
But you, O Lord, are a merciful and loving God,
Turn to me and have mercy on me;
Show me proof of your goodness, Lord ;

87.verse_text: The Lord built his city on the sacred hill; he loves the city of Jerusalem. to the wonderful things he says about you: when I list the nations that obey me; I will number among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.” that all nations belong there and that the Almighty will make her strong. and include them all as citizens of Jerusalem. “In Zion is the source of all our blessings.”
more than any other place in Israel
“I will include Egypt and Babylonia the people of Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia
Of Zion it will be said
The Lord will write a list of the peoples

88.verse_text: Lord God, my savior, I cry out all day, and at night I come before you. listen to my cry for help! that I am close to death. I am like the slain lying in their graves, those you have forgotten completely, who are beyond your help. into the darkest and deepest pit. and I am crushed beneath its waves. you have made me repulsive to them. I am closed in and cannot escape; Lord , every day I call to you and lift my hands to you in prayer. Do they rise up and praise you? or your faithfulness in the place of destruction? or your goodness in the land of the forgotten? every morning I pray to you. Why do you turn away from me? your terrible attacks destroy me. they close in on me from every side. and darkness is my only companion.
So many troubles have fallen on me
I am like all others who are about to die; all my strength is gone. I am worn out from the burden of your punishments.
I am abandoned among the dead;
You have thrown me into the depths of the tomb,
Your anger lies heavy on me,
You have caused my friends to abandon me;
my eyes are weak from suffering.
Do you perform miracles for the dead?
Is your constant love spoken of in the grave
Are your miracles seen in that place of darkness
Lord , I call to you for help;
Why do you reject me, Lord ?
Ever since I was young, I have suffered and been near death;
All day long they surround me like a flood;
You have made even my closest friends abandon me,

89.verse_text: O Lord , I will always sing of your constant love; I will proclaim your faithfulness forever. that your faithfulness is as permanent as the sky. I have promised my servant David, I will preserve your dynasty forever.’” the holy ones sing of your faithfulness, Lord . none of the heavenly beings is your equal. they all stand in awe of you. in all things you are faithful, O Lord . you calm its angry waves. with your mighty strength you defeated your enemies. you made the world and everything in it. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing to you for joy. How great is your strength! love and faithfulness are shown in all you do. who live in the light of your kindness! and they praise you for your goodness. in your love you make us triumphant. you, the Holy God of Israel, gave us our king. “I have given help to a famous soldier; I have given the throne to one I chose from the people. by anointing him with holy oil. my power will make him strong. the wicked will not defeat him. and kill everyone who hates him. I will make him always victorious. from the Mediterranean to the Euphrates River. ‘You are my father and my God; you are my protector and savior.’ the greatest of all kings. and my covenant with him will last forever. a descendant of his will always be king. and do not live according to my commands, and do not keep my commandments, I will make them suffer for their wrongs. or fail to keep my promise to him. or take back even one promise I made him. I will never lie to David. and I will watch over his kingdom as long as the sun shines. that faithful witness in the sky.” you have deserted and rejected him. and thrown his crown in the dirt. and left his forts in ruins. all his neighbors laugh at him. you have made them all happy. and let him be defeated in battle. and knocked his throne to the ground. and covered him with disgrace. How long will your anger burn like fire? remember that you created all of us mortal! How can we humans keep ourselves from the grave? Where are the promises you made to David? They insult him wherever he goes. Amen! Amen!
I know that your love will last for all time,
You said, “I have made a covenant with the man I chose;
‘A descendant of yours will always be king;
The heavens sing of the wonderful things you do;
No one in heaven is like you, Lord ;
You are feared in the council of the holy ones;
Lord God Almighty, none is as mighty as you;
You rule over the powerful sea;
You crushed the monster Rahab and killed it;
Heaven is yours, the earth also;
You created the north and the south;
How powerful you are!
Your kingdom is founded on righteousness and justice;
How happy are the people who worship you with songs,
Because of you they rejoice all day long,
You give us great victories;
You, O Lord , chose our protector;
In a vision long ago you said to your faithful servants,
I have made my servant David king
My strength will always be with him,
His enemies will never succeed against him;
I will crush his foes
I will love him and be loyal to him;
I will extend his kingdom
He will say to me,
I will make him my first-born son,
I will always keep my promise to him,
His dynasty will be as permanent as the sky;
“But if his descendants disobey my law
if they disregard my instructions
then I will punish them for their sins;
But I will not stop loving David
I will not break my covenant with him
“Once and for all I have promised by my holy name:
He will always have descendants,
It will be as permanent as the moon,
But you are angry with your chosen king;
You have broken your covenant with your servant
You have torn down the walls of his city
All who pass by steal his belongings;
You have given the victory to his enemies;
You have made his weapons useless
You have taken away his royal scepter
You have made him old before his time
Lord , will you hide yourself forever?
Remember how short my life is;
Who can live and never die?
Lord, where are the former proofs of your love?
Don't forget how I, your servant, am insulted, how I endure all the curses of the heathen.
Your enemies insult your chosen king, O Lord !
Praise the Lord forever!

90.verse_text: O Lord, you have always been our home. or brought the world into being, you were eternally God, and will be God forever. you change us back to dust. they are like yesterday, already gone, like a short hour in the night. we last no longer than a dream. We are like weeds that sprout in the morning, then dry up and die in the evening. we are terrified by your fury. our secret sins where you can see them. it fades away like a whisper. eighty years, if we are strong; yet all they bring us is trouble and sorrow; life is soon over, and we are gone. Who knows what fear your fury can bring? so that we may become wise. Have pity, O Lord , on your servants! so that we may sing and be glad all our life. during all our years of misery. let our descendants see your glorious might. Give us success in all we do!
You tell us to return to what we were;
A thousand years to you are like one day;
You carry us away like a flood;
that grow and burst into bloom,
We are destroyed by your anger;
You place our sins before you,
Our life is cut short by your anger;
Seventy years is all we have—
Who has felt the full power of your anger?
Teach us how short our life is,
How much longer will your anger last?
Fill us each morning with your constant love,
Give us now as much happiness as the sadness you gave us
Let us, your servants, see your mighty deeds;
Lord our God, may your blessings be with us.

91.verse_text: Whoever goes to the Lord for safety, whoever remains under the protection of the Almighty, “You are my defender and protector. You are my God; in you I trust.” and from all deadly diseases. you will be safe in his care; his faithfulness will protect and defend you. or sudden attacks during the day or the evils that kill in daylight. ten thousand all around you, but you will not be harmed. how the wicked are punished. the Most High your protector, no violence will come near your home. to protect you wherever you go. to keep you from hurting your feet on the stones. fierce lions and poisonous snakes. and will protect those who acknowledge me as Lord . when they are in trouble, I will be with them. I will rescue them and honor them. I will save them.”
He will keep you safe from all hidden dangers
He will cover you with his wings;
You need not fear any dangers at night
or the plagues that strike in the dark
A thousand may fall dead beside you,
You have made the Lord your defender,
and so no disaster will strike you,
God will put his angels in charge of you
They will hold you up with their hands
You will trample down lions and snakes,
God says, “I will save those who love me
When they call to me, I will answer them;
I will reward them with long life;

92.verse_text: How good it is to give thanks to you, O Lord , to sing in your honor, O Most High God, and your faithfulness every night, and with melody on the harp. because of what you have done, I sing for joy. How deep are your thoughts! someone who is stupid cannot understand: those who do wrong may prosper; yet they will be totally destroyed, and all the wicked will be defeated. you have blessed me with happiness. and heard the cries of the wicked. they will grow like the cedars of Lebanon. that flourish in the Temple of our God, and are always green and strong. that there is no wrong in my protector.
to proclaim your constant love every morning
with the music of stringed instruments
Your mighty deeds, O Lord , make me glad;
How great are your actions, Lord !
This is something a fool cannot know;
the wicked may grow like weeds,
because you, Lord , are supreme forever.
We know that your enemies will die,
You have made me as strong as a wild ox;
I have seen the defeat of my enemies
The righteous will flourish like palm trees;
They are like trees planted in the house of the Lord ,
that still bear fruit in old age
This shows that the Lord is just,

93.verse_text: The Lord is king. He is clothed with majesty and strength. The earth is set firmly in place and cannot be moved. and you existed before time began. they raise their voice and roar. greater than the roar of the ocean, more powerful than the waves of the sea. and your Temple is holy indeed, forever and ever.
Your throne, O Lord , has been firm from the beginning,
The ocean depths raise their voice, O Lord ;
The Lord rules supreme in heaven,

94.verse_text: Lord , you are a God who punishes; reveal your anger! rise and give the proud what they deserve! How much longer, Lord ? and boast about their crimes? they oppress those who belong to you. and murder the strangers who live in our land. the God of Israel does not notice.” When will you ever learn? He made our eyes—can't he see? He is the teacher of us all—hasn't he any knowledge? he knows how senseless our reasoning is. the ones to whom you teach your law! until a pit is dug to trap the wicked. he will not desert those who belong to him. and all righteous people will support it. Who took my side against the evildoers? but your constant love, O Lord , held me up. you comfort me and make me glad. who make injustice legal, and sentence the innocent to death. my God protects me. and destroy them for their sins; the Lord our God will destroy them.
You are the judge of us all;
How much longer will the wicked be glad?
How much longer will criminals be proud
They crush your people, Lord ;
They kill widows and orphans,
They say, “The Lord does not see us;
My people, how can you be such stupid fools?
God made our ears—can't he hear?
He scolds the nations—won't he punish them?
The Lord knows what we think;
Lord , how happy are those you instruct,
You give them rest from days of trouble
The Lord will not abandon his people;
Justice will again be found in the courts,
Who stood up for me against the wicked?
If the Lord had not helped me, I would have gone quickly to the land of silence.
I said, “I am falling”;
Whenever I am anxious and worried,
You have nothing to do with corrupt judges,
who plot against good people
But the Lord defends me;
He will punish them for their wickedness

95.verse_text: Come, let us praise the Lord ! Let us sing for joy to God, who protects us! and sing joyful songs of praise. a mighty king over all the gods. from the deepest caves to the highest hills. the land also, which he himself formed. let us kneel before the Lord , our Maker! we are the people he cares for, the flock for which he provides. Listen today to what he says: as they were that day in the desert at Massah. although they had seen what I did for them. I said, ‘How disloyal they are! They refuse to obey my commands.’ ‘You will never enter the land where I would have given you rest.’”
Let us come before him with thanksgiving
For the Lord is a mighty God,
He rules over the whole earth,
He rules over the sea, which he made;
Come, let us bow down and worship him;
“Don't be stubborn, as your ancestors were at Meribah,
There they put me to the test and tried me,
For forty years I was disgusted with those people.
I was angry and made a solemn promise:

96.verse_text: Sing a new song to the Lord ! Sing to the Lord , all the world! Proclaim every day the good news that he has saved us. his mighty deeds to all peoples. he is to be honored more than all the gods. but the Lord created the heavens. power and beauty fill his Temple. praise his glory and might. bring an offering and come into his Temple. tremble before him, all the earth! The earth is set firmly in place and cannot be moved; he will judge the peoples with justice.” Roar, sea, and every creature in you; The trees in the woods will shout for joy He will rule the peoples of the world with justice and fairness.
Sing to the Lord , and praise him!
Proclaim his glory to the nations,
The Lord is great and is to be highly praised;
The gods of all other nations are only idols,
Praise the Lord , all people on earth;
Bow down before the Holy One when he appears;
Say to all the nations, “The Lord is king!
be glad, fields, and everything in you!
when the Lord comes to rule the earth.

97.verse_text: The Lord is king! Earth, be glad! Rejoice, you islands of the seas! he rules with righteousness and justice. and burns up his enemies around him. the earth sees it and trembles. before the Lord of all the earth. and all the nations see his glory. and the cities of Judah rejoice because of your judgments, O Lord . you are much greater than all the gods. he protects the lives of his people; he rescues them from the power of the wicked. and gladness on the good. because of what the Lord has done! Remember what the holy God has done, and give thanks to him.
Fire goes in front of him
His lightning lights up the world;
The hills melt like wax before the Lord ,
Everyone who worships idols is put to shame; all the gods bow down before the Lord .
The people of Zion are glad,
Lord Almighty, you are ruler of all the earth;
The Lord loves those who hate evil;
All you that are righteous be glad

98.verse_text: Sing a new song to the Lord ; he has done wonderful things! By his own power and holy strength he has won the victory. he made his saving power known to the nations. with loyalty and constant love for them. All people everywhere have seen the victory of our God. praise him with songs and shouts of joy! Play music on the harps! and shout for joy to the Lord , our king. sing, earth, and all who live on you! you hills, sing together with joy before the Lord , He will rule the peoples of the world with justice and fairness.
He kept his promise to the people of Israel
Sing for joy to the Lord , all the earth;
Roar, sea, and every creature in you;
because he comes to rule the earth.

99.verse_text: The Lord is king, and the people tremble. He sits on his throne above the winged creatures, and the earth shakes. he is supreme over all the nations. Holy is he! you have established justice in Israel; you have brought righteousness and fairness. worship before his throne! Holy is he! and Samuel was one who prayed to him; they called to the Lord , and he answered them. they obeyed the laws and commands that he gave them. you showed them that you are a God who forgives, even though you punished them for their sins. The Lord our God is holy.
The Lord is mighty in Zion;
Everyone will praise his great and majestic name.
Mighty king, you love what is right;
Moses and Aaron were his priests,
He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud;
O Lord , our God, you answered your people;
Praise the Lord our God, and worship at his sacred hill!

100.verse_text: Sing to the Lord , all the world! come before him with happy songs! He made us, and we belong to him; we are his people, we are his flock. go into its courts with praise. Give thanks to him and praise him. his love is eternal and his faithfulness lasts forever.
Acknowledge that the Lord is God.
Enter the Temple gates with thanksgiving;

101.verse_text: My song is about loyalty and justice, and I sing it to you, O Lord . When will you come to me? I will live a pure life in my house I hate the actions of those who turn away from God; I will have nothing to do with them. who whispers evil things about someone else; I will not tolerate anyone who is proud and arrogant. and will let them live in my palace. Those who are completely honest will be allowed to serve me. no hypocrite will remain in my presence. the wicked in our land; I will expel all who are evil from the city of the Lord .
I will not be dishonest and will have no dealings with evil.
I will get rid of anyone
I will approve of those who are faithful to God
No liar will live in my palace;
Day after day I will destroy

102.verse_text: Listen to my prayer, O Lord , and hear my cry for help! don't turn away from me! Listen to me, and answer me quickly when I call! my body is burning like fire. I have lost my desire for food. I am nothing but skin and bones. like an owl in abandoned ruins. I am like a lonely bird on a housetop. those who mock me use my name in cursing. ashes are my food, and my tears are mixed with my drink. You picked me up and threw me away. I am like dry grass. all generations will remember you. the time has come to have mercy on her; this is the right time. even though she is destroyed; they have pity on her, even though she is in ruins. all the kings of the earth will fear his power. he will reveal his greatness. and listen to their prayer. so that people not yet born will praise him. he looked down from heaven to earth. and set free those who were condemned to die. and he will be praised in Jerusalem and worship the Lord . he has shortened my life. before I grow old. O Lord , you live forever; and with your own hands you made the heavens. they will all wear out like clothes. You will discard them like clothes, and they will vanish. and your life never ends. and under your protection their descendants will be secure.
When I am in trouble,
My life is disappearing like smoke;
I am beaten down like dry grass;
I groan aloud;
I am like a wild bird in the desert,
I lie awake;
All day long my enemies insult me;
My life is like the evening shadows;
But you, O Lord , are king forever;
You will rise and take pity on Zion;
Your servants love her,
The nations will fear the Lord ;
When the Lord rebuilds Zion,
He will hear his forsaken people
Write down for the coming generation what the Lord has done,
The Lord looked down from his holy place on high,
He heard the groans of prisoners
And so his name will be proclaimed in Zion,
when nations and kingdoms come together
The Lord has made me weak while I am still young;
O God, do not take me away now
long ago you created the earth,
They will disappear, but you will remain;
But you are always the same,
Our children will live in safety,

103.verse_text: Praise the Lord , my soul! All my being, praise his holy name! and do not forget how kind he is. and heals all my diseases. and blesses me with love and mercy. so that I stay young and strong like an eagle. and gives them their rights. and let the people of Israel see his mighty deeds. slow to become angry and full of constant love. he is not angry forever. or repay us according to our sins and wrongs. so great is his love for those who honor him. so far does he remove our sins from us. so the Lord is kind to those who honor him. he remembers that we are dust. We grow and flourish like a wild flower; no one sees it again. and his goodness endures for all generations and who faithfully obey his commands. he is king over all. who obey his commands, who listen to what he says. you servants of his, who do his will! in all the places he rules. Praise the Lord , my soul!
Praise the Lord , my soul,
He forgives all my sins
He keeps me from the grave
He fills my life with good things,
The Lord judges in favor of the oppressed
He revealed his plans to Moses
The Lord is merciful and loving,
He does not keep on rebuking;
He does not punish us as we deserve
As high as the sky is above the earth,
As far as the east is from the west,
As a father is kind to his children,
He knows what we are made of;
As for us, our life is like grass.
then the wind blows on it, and it is gone—
But for those who honor the Lord , his love lasts forever,
of those who are true to his covenant
The Lord placed his throne in heaven;
Praise the Lord , you strong and mighty angels,
Praise the Lord , all you heavenly powers,
Praise the Lord , all his creatures

104.verse_text: Praise the Lord , my soul! O Lord , my God, how great you are! You are clothed with majesty and glory; You have spread out the heavens like a tent You use the clouds as your chariot and ride on the wings of the wind. and flashes of lightning as your servants. and it will never be moved. and the water covered the mountains. they rushed away when they heard your shout of command. to the place you had made for them. to keep them from covering the earth again. and rivers run between the hills. there the wild donkeys quench their thirst. the birds make their nests and sing. and the earth is filled with your blessings. and plants for us to use, so that we can grow our crops olive oil to make us cheerful, and bread to give us strength. the Lord 's own trees, which he planted. the storks nest in the fir trees. and the rock badgers hide in the cliffs. the sun knows the time to set. all the wild animals come out. looking for the food that God provides. and lie down in their dens. and keep working until evening. How wisely you made them all! The earth is filled with your creatures. where countless creatures live, large and small alike. to give them food when they need it. you provide food, and they are satisfied. when you take away your breath, they die and go back to the dust from which they came. you give new life to the earth. May the Lord be happy with what he has made! he touches the mountains, and they pour out smoke. as long as I live I will sing praises to my God. for my gladness comes from him. may the wicked be no more. Praise the Lord , my soul! Praise the Lord !
you cover yourself with light.
and built your home on the waters above.
You use the winds as your messengers
You have set the earth firmly on its foundations,
You placed the ocean over it like a robe,
When you rebuked the waters, they fled;
They flowed over the mountains and into the valleys,
You set a boundary they can never pass,
You make springs flow in the valleys,
They provide water for the wild animals;
In the trees near by,
From the sky you send rain on the hills,
You make grass grow for the cattle
and produce wine to make us happy,
The cedars of Lebanon get plenty of rain—
There the birds build their nests;
The wild goats live in the high mountains,
You created the moon to mark the months;
You made the night, and in the darkness
The young lions roar while they hunt,
When the sun rises, they go back
Then people go out to do their work
Lord , you have made so many things!
There is the ocean, large and wide,
The ships sail on it, and in it plays Leviathan, that sea monster which you made.
All of them depend on you
You give it to them, and they eat it;
When you turn away, they are afraid;
But when you give them breath, they are created;
May the glory of the Lord last forever!
He looks at the earth, and it trembles;
I will sing to the Lord all my life;
May he be pleased with my song,
May sinners be destroyed from the earth;

105.verse_text: Give thanks to the Lord , proclaim his greatness; tell the nations what he has done. tell the wonderful things he has done. let all who worship him rejoice. and worship him continually. you descendants of Jacob, the man he chose: remember the miracles that God performed and the judgments that he gave. his commands are for all the world. his promises for a thousand generations. and his promise to Isaac. one that will last forever. “It will be your own possession.” strangers in the land of Canaan. from one kingdom to another. to protect them, he warned the kings: do not touch my prophets.” and took away all their food. Joseph, who had been sold as a slave. and an iron collar was around his neck, The word of the Lord proved him right. the ruler of nations set him free. and made him ruler over all the land, and authority to instruct his advisers. and settled in that country. and made them stronger than their enemies. and treat his servants with deceit. and Aaron, whom he had chosen. and performed miracles in Egypt. and killed all their fish. even the palace was filled with them. swarmed throughout the whole country. instead of rain; and broke down all the trees. countless millions of them; they ate all the crops. of all the families of Egypt. they carried silver and gold, and all of them were healthy and strong. and were glad when they left. and a fire at night to give them light. he gave them food from heaven to satisfy them. flowing through the desert like a river. to Abraham his servant. and they sang and shouted for joy. and let them take over their fields, and keep all his commands. Praise the Lord !
Sing praise to the Lord ;
Be glad that we belong to him;
Go to the Lord for help;
The Lord is our God;
He will keep his covenant forever,
He will keep the agreement he made with Abraham
The Lord made a covenant with Jacob,
“I will give you the land of Canaan,” he said.
God's people were few in number,
They wandered from country to country,
But God let no one oppress them;
“Don't harm my chosen servants;
The Lord sent famine to their country
But he sent a man ahead of them,
His feet were kept in chains,
until what he had predicted came true.
Then the king of Egypt had him released;
He put him in charge of his government
with power over the king's officials
Then Jacob went to Egypt
The Lord gave many children to his people
He made the Egyptians hate his people
Then he sent his servant Moses,
They did God's mighty acts
God sent darkness on the country, but the Egyptians did not obey his command.
He turned their rivers into blood
Their country was overrun with frogs;
God commanded, and flies and gnats
He sent hail and lightning on their land
he destroyed their grapevines and fig trees
He commanded, and the locusts came,
they ate all the plants in the land;
He killed the first-born sons
Then he led the Israelites out;
The Egyptians were afraid of them
God put a cloud over his people
They asked, and he sent quails;
He opened a rock, and water gushed out,
He remembered his sacred promise
So he led his chosen people out,
He gave them the lands of other peoples
so that his people would obey his laws

106.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Give thanks to the Lord , because he is good; his love is eternal. Who can praise him enough? who always do what is right. include me when you save them. and share in the happiness of your nation, in the glad pride of those who belong to you. we have been wicked and evil. they forgot the many times he showed them his love, in order to show his great power. and it dried up; he led his people across on dry land. he rescued them from their enemies. not one of them was left. and sang praises to him. and acted without waiting for his advice. and put God to the test; but also sent a terrible disease among them. and of Aaron, the Lord 's holy servant. and buried Abiram and his family; and burned up those wicked people. and worshiped that idol; for the image of an animal that eats grass. by his mighty acts in Egypt. What amazing things at the Red Sea! his chosen servant, Moses, stood up against God and kept his anger from destroying them. because they did not believe God's promise. and would not listen to the Lord . that he would make them die in the desert letting them die in foreign countries. and ate sacrifices offered to dead gods. and a terrible disease broke out among them. and the plague was stopped. and will be for all time to come. and Moses was in trouble on their account. that he spoke without stopping to think. as the Lord had commanded them to do, and adopted their pagan ways. and this caused their destruction. as sacrifices to the idols of Canaan. and the land was defiled by those murders. and were unfaithful to God. he was disgusted with them. and their enemies ruled over them. and were in complete subjection to them. but they chose to rebel against him and sank deeper into sin. and he took notice of their distress. and because of his great love he relented. feel sorry for them. and bring us back from among the nations, so that we may be thankful and praise your holy name. praise him now and forever! Let everyone say, “Amen!” Praise the Lord !
Who can tell all the great things he has done?
Happy are those who obey his commands,
Remember me, Lord , when you help your people;
Let me see the prosperity of your people
We have sinned as our ancestors did;
Our ancestors in Egypt did not understand God's wonderful acts; and they rebelled against the Almighty at the Red Sea.
But he saved them, as he had promised,
He gave a command to the Red Sea,
He saved them from those who hated them;
But the water drowned their enemies;
Then his people believed his promises
But they quickly forgot what he had done
They were filled with craving in the desert
so he gave them what they asked for,
There in the desert they were jealous of Moses
Then the earth opened up and swallowed Dathan
fire came down on their followers
They made a gold bull-calf at Sinai
they exchanged the glory of God
They forgot the God who had saved them
What wonderful things he did there!
When God said that he would destroy his people,
Then they rejected the pleasant land,
They stayed in their tents and grumbled
So he gave them a solemn warning
and scatter their descendants among the heathen,
Then at Peor, God's people joined in the worship of Baal
They stirred up the Lord 's anger by their actions,
But Phinehas stood up and punished the guilty,
This has been remembered in his favor ever since
At the springs of Meribah the people made the Lord angry,
They made him so bitter
They did not kill the heathen,
but they intermarried with them
God's people worshiped idols,
They offered their own sons and daughters
They killed those innocent children,
They made themselves impure by their actions
So the Lord was angry with his people;
He abandoned them to the power of the heathen,
They were oppressed by their enemies
Many times the Lord rescued his people,
Yet the Lord heard them when they cried out,
For their sake he remembered his covenant,
He made all their oppressors
Save us, O Lord our God,
Praise the Lord , the God of Israel;

107.verse_text: “Give thanks to the Lord , because he is good; his love is eternal!” all you whom he has saved. He has rescued you from your enemies and could not find their way to a city to live in. and had given up all hope. and he saved them from their distress. to a city where they could live. for the wonderful things he did for them. and fills the hungry with good things. prisoners suffering in chains, and had rejected his instructions. they would fall down, and no one would help. and he saved them from their distress. and broke their chains in pieces. for the wonderful things he did for them. and smashes iron bars. and because of their evil; and were close to death. and he saved them from their distress. and saved them from the grave. for the wonderful things he did for them. and with songs of joy must tell all that he has done. earning their living on the seas. his wonderful acts on the seas. and stirred up the waves. and plunged down into the depths. In such danger the sailors lost their courage; all their skill was useless. and he saved them from their distress. and the waves became quiet. and he brought them safe to the port they wanted. for the wonderful things he did for them. and praise him before the council of the leaders. and stopped springs from flowing. because of the wickedness of those who lived there. and dry land into flowing springs. and they built a city to live in. and reaped an abundant harvest. he kept their herds of cattle from decreasing. by cruel oppression and suffering, and made them wander in trackless deserts. and made their families increase like flocks. but all the wicked are put to silence. may they consider the Lord 's constant love.
Repeat these words in praise to the Lord ,
and has brought you back from foreign countries, from east and west, from north and south.
Some wandered in the trackless desert
They were hungry and thirsty
Then in their trouble they called to the Lord ,
He led them by a straight road
They must thank the Lord for his constant love,
He satisfies those who are thirsty
Some were living in gloom and darkness,
because they had rebelled against the commands of Almighty God
They were worn out from hard work;
Then in their trouble they called to the Lord ,
He brought them out of their gloom and darkness
They must thank the Lord for his constant love,
He breaks down doors of bronze
Some were fools, suffering because of their sins
they couldn't stand the sight of food
Then in their trouble they called to the Lord ,
He healed them with his command
They must thank the Lord for his constant love,
They must thank him with sacrifices,
Some sailed over the ocean in ships,
They saw what the Lord can do,
He commanded, and a mighty wind began to blow
The ships were lifted high in the air
they stumbled and staggered like drunks—
Then in their trouble they called to the Lord ,
He calmed the raging storm,
They were glad because of the calm,
They must thank the Lord for his constant love,
They must proclaim his greatness in the assembly of the people
The Lord made rivers dry up completely
He made rich soil become a salty wasteland
He changed deserts into pools of water
He let hungry people settle there,
They sowed the fields and planted grapevines
He blessed his people, and they had many children;
When God's people were defeated and humiliated
he showed contempt for their oppressors
But he rescued the needy from their misery
The righteous see this and are glad,
May those who are wise think about these things;

108.verse_text: I have complete confidence, O God! I will sing and praise you! Wake up, my soul! I will wake up the sun. I will praise you among the peoples. your faithfulness touches the skies. and your glory over all the earth. so that the people you love may be rescued. “In triumph I will divide Shechem and distribute Sukkoth Valley to my people. Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my royal scepter. and I will throw my sandals on Edom, as a sign that I own it. I will shout in triumph over the Philistines.” Who will lead me to Edom? Aren't you going to march out with our armies? human help is worthless. he will defeat our enemies.
Wake up, my harp and lyre!
I will thank you, O Lord , among the nations.
Your constant love reaches above the heavens;
Show your greatness in the sky, O God,
Save us by your might; answer my prayer,
From his sanctuary God has said,
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh too;
But I will use Moab as my washbowl,
Who, O God, will take me into the fortified city?
With God on our side we will win;

109.verse_text: I praise you, God; don't remain silent! They tell lies about me, attacking me for no reason. and hatred for love. and let one of his own enemies accuse him. may even his prayer be considered a crime! may someone else take his job! and his wife a widow! and may strangers get everything he worked for. or care for the orphans he leaves behind. and may his name be forgotten in the next generation. and never forgive his mother's sins. but may they themselves be completely forgotten! he persecuted and killed the poor, the needy, and the helpless. He hated to give blessings—may no one bless him! may his own curses soak into his body like water and into his bones like oil! and always be around him like a belt! those who say such evil things against me! and rescue me because of the goodness of your love. I am hurt to the depths of my heart. I am blown away like an insect. I am nothing but skin and bones. they shake their heads in scorn. because of your constant love, save me! that you are the one who saves me. and may I, your servant, be glad. may they wear their shame like a robe. I will praise him in the assembly of the people, and saves them from those who condemn them to death.
Wicked people and liars have attacked me.
and they say evil things about me,
They oppose me, even though I love them and have prayed for them. may they be driven from the ruins they live in! May my persecutors be defeated,
They pay me back evil for good
Choose some corrupt judge to try my enemy,
May he be tried and found guilty;
May his life soon be ended;
May his children become orphans,
May his children be homeless beggars;
May his creditors take away all his property,
May no one ever be kind to him
May all his descendants die,
May the Lord remember the evil of his ancestors
May the Lord always remember their sins,
That man never thought of being kind;
He loved to curse—may he be cursed!
He cursed as naturally as he dressed himself;
May they cover him like clothes
Lord , punish my enemies in that way—

He made the sun and the moon;
the sun to rule over the day;
the moon and the stars to rule over the night;
He killed the first-born sons of the Egyptians;
He led the people of Israel out of Egypt;
with his strong hand, his powerful arm;
He divided the Red Sea;
he led his people through it;
but he drowned the king of Egypt and his army;
He led his people through the desert;
He killed powerful kings;
he killed famous kings;
Sihon, king of the Amorites;
and Og, king of Bashan;
He gave their lands to his people;
he gave them to Israel, his servant;
He did not forget us when we were defeated;
he freed us from our enemies;
He gives food to every living creature;
Give thanks to the God of heaven;

137.verse_text: By the rivers of Babylon we sat down; there we wept when we remembered Zion. we hung up our harps. they told us to entertain them: “Sing us a song about Zion.” in a foreign land? if I forget you, Jerusalem! if I do not remember you, if I do not think of you as my greatest joy! the day Jerusalem was captured. Remember how they kept saying, “Tear it down to the ground!” Happy are those who pay you back for what you have done to us— and smash them against a rock.
Those who captured us told us to sing;
How can we sing a song to the Lord
May I never be able to play the harp again
May I never be able to sing again
Remember, Lord , what the Edomites did

138.verse_text: I thank you, Lord , with all my heart; I sing praise to you before the gods. bow down, and praise your name because of your constant love and faithfulness, with your strength you strengthened me. because they have heard your promises. and about your great glory. you care for the lowly, and the proud cannot hide from you. you keep me safe. You oppose my angry enemies and save me by your power. Lord , your love is eternal. Complete the work that you have begun.
I face your holy Temple, because you have shown that your name and your commands are supreme.
You answered me when I called to you;
All the kings in the world will praise you, Lord ,
They will sing about what you have done
Even though you are so high above,
When I am surrounded by troubles,
You will do everything you have promised;

139.verse_text: Lord , you have examined me and you know me. from far away you understand all my thoughts. you know all my actions. you already know what I will say. you protect me with your power. it is beyond my understanding. Where could I get away from your presence? if I lay down in the world of the dead, you would be there. or lived in the farthest place in the west, you would be there to help me. or the light around me to turn into night, and the night is as bright as the day. Darkness and light are the same to you. you put me together in my mother's womb. all you do is strange and wonderful. I know it with all my heart. carefully put together in my mother's womb, when I was growing there in secret, you knew that I was there— The days allotted to me had all been recorded in your book, before any of them ever began. how many of them there are! When I awake, I am still with you. How I wish violent people would leave me alone! How I despise those who rebel against you! I regard them as my enemies. test me, and discover my thoughts.
You know everything I do;
You see me, whether I am working or resting;
Even before I speak,
You are all around me on every side;
Your knowledge of me is too deep;
Where could I go to escape from you?
If I went up to heaven, you would be there;
If I flew away beyond the east
you would be there to lead me,
I could ask the darkness to hide me
but even darkness is not dark for you,
You created every part of me;
I praise you because you are to be feared;
When my bones were being formed,
you saw me before I was born.
O God, how difficult I find your thoughts;
If I counted them, they would be more than the grains of sand.
O God, how I wish you would kill the wicked!
They say wicked things about you; they speak evil things against your name. and guide me in the everlasting way.
O Lord , how I hate those who hate you!
I hate them with a total hatred;
Examine me, O God, and know my mind;
Find out if there is any evil in me

140.verse_text: Save me, Lord , from evildoers; keep me safe from violent people. always stirring up quarrels. their words are like a cobra's poison. keep me safe from violent people who plot my downfall. they have laid their snares, and along the path they have set traps to catch me. Hear my cry for help, Lord ! you have protected me in battle. don't let their plots succeed. make their threats against me fall back on them. may they be thrown into a pit and never get out. may evil overtake violent people and destroy them. and the rights of the needy. they will live in your presence.
Their tongues are like deadly snakes;
Protect me, Lord , from the power of the wicked;
The proud have set a trap for me;
I say to the Lord , “You are my God.”
My Sovereign Lord , my strong defender,
Lord , don't give the wicked what they want;
Don't let my enemies be victorious;
May red-hot coals fall on them;
May those who accuse others falsely not succeed;
Lord , I know that you defend the cause of the poor
The righteous will praise you indeed;

141.verse_text: I call to you, Lord ; help me now! Listen to me when I call to you. my uplifted hands as an evening sacrifice. a sentry at the door of my lips. and from joining evil people in their wickedness. May I never take part in their feasts. but I will never accept honor from evil people, because I am always praying against their evil deeds. the people will admit that my words were true. I seek your protection; don't let me die! from the snares of those evildoers. while I go by unharmed.
Lord , place a guard at my mouth,
Keep me from wanting to do wrong
Good people may punish me and rebuke me in kindness,
When their rulers are thrown down from rocky cliffs,
Like wood that is split and chopped into bits, so their bones are scattered at the edge of the grave.
But I keep trusting in you, my Sovereign Lord .
Protect me from the traps they have set for me,
May the wicked fall into their own traps

142.verse_text: I call to the Lord for help; I plead with him. I tell him all my troubles. he knows what I should do. In the path where I walk, my enemies have hidden a trap for me. I see that there is no one to help me, no one to protect me. No one cares for me. you, Lord , are my protector; you are all I want in this life. for I am sunk in despair. Save me from my enemies; they are too strong for me. then in the assembly of your people I will praise you because of your goodness to me.
I bring him all my complaints;
When I am ready to give up,
Lord , I cry to you for help;
Listen to my cry for help,
Set me free from my distress;

143.verse_text: Lord , hear my prayer! In your righteousness listen to my plea; answer me in your faithfulness! no one is innocent in your sight. and completely defeated me. They have put me in a dark prison, and I am like those who died long ago. I am in deep despair. I think about all that you have done, I bring to mind all your deeds. like dry ground my soul is thirsty for you. I have lost all hope. Don't hide yourself from me, or I will be among those who go down to the world of the dead. for I put my trust in you. My prayers go up to you; show me the way I should go. rescue me from my enemies. teach me to do your will. Be good to me, and guide me on a safe path. in your goodness save me from my troubles! and destroy all my oppressors, for I am your servant.
Don't put me, your servant, on trial;
My enemies have hunted me down
So I am ready to give up;
I remember the days gone by;
I lift up my hands to you in prayer;
Remind me each morning of your constant love,
I go to you for protection, Lord ;
Rescue me, Lord , as you have promised;
Because of your love for me, kill my enemies

144.verse_text: Praise the Lord , my protector! He trains me for battle and prepares me for war. my shelter and savior, in whom I trust for safety. He subdues the nations under me. mere mortals, that you pay attention to us? our days are like a passing shadow. touch the mountains, and they will pour out smoke. shoot your arrows and send them running. pull me out of the deep water, and rescue me; save me from the power of foreigners, and lie even under oath. I will play the harp and sing to you. and rescue your servant David. rescue me from the power of foreigners, who never tell the truth and lie even under oath. be like plants that grow up strong. May our daughters be like stately columns which adorn the corners of a palace. with crops of every kind. May the sheep in our fields bear young by the tens of thousands. without miscarriage or loss. May there be no cries of distress in our streets. happy are the people whose God is the Lord !
He is my protector and defender,
Lord , what are mortals, that you notice them;
We are like a puff of wind;
O Lord , tear the sky open and come down;
Send flashes of lightning and scatter your enemies;
I will sing you a new song, O God;
Save me from my cruel enemies;
May our sons in their youth
Happy is the nation of whom this is true;

145.verse_text: I will proclaim your greatness, my God and king; I will thank you forever and ever. I will praise you forever and ever. his greatness is beyond understanding. they will proclaim your mighty acts. and I will meditate on your wonderful deeds. and I will proclaim your greatness. and sing about your kindness. slow to become angry and full of constant love. and has compassion on all he made. and all your people will give you thanks. and tell of your might, and the glorious majesty of your kingdom. and you are king forever. The Lord is faithful to his promises; he is merciful in all his acts. he lifts those who have fallen. and you give them food when they need it. and satisfy the needs of all. merciful in all his acts. who call to him with sincerity. he hears their cries and saves them. but he will destroy the wicked. let all his creatures praise his holy name forever.
Every day I will thank you;
The Lord is great and is to be highly praised;
What you have done will be praised from one generation to the next;
They will speak of your glory and majesty,
People will speak of your mighty deeds,
They will tell about all your goodness
The Lord is loving and merciful,
He is good to everyone
All your creatures, Lord , will praise you,
They will speak of the glory of your royal power
so that everyone will know your mighty deeds
Your rule is eternal,
He helps those who are in trouble;
All living things look hopefully to you,
You give them enough
The Lord is righteous in all he does,
He is near to those who call to him,
He supplies the needs of those who honor him;
He protects everyone who loves him,
I will always praise the Lord ;

146.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Praise the Lord , my soul! I will sing to my God all my life. no human being can save you. on that day all their plans come to an end. and who depend on the Lord their God, and all that is in them. He always keeps his promises; and gives food to the hungry. The Lord sets prisoners free He lifts those who have fallen; he loves his righteous people. he helps widows and orphans, but takes the wicked to their ruin. Your God, O Zion, will reign for all time. Praise the Lord !
I will praise him as long as I live;
Don't put your trust in human leaders;
When they die, they return to the dust;
Happy are those who have the God of Jacob to help them
the Creator of heaven, earth, and sea,
he judges in favor of the oppressed
and gives sight to the blind.
He protects the strangers who live in our land;

147.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! It is good to sing praise to our God; it is pleasant and right to praise him. he is bringing back the exiles. and bandages their wounds. and calls each one by name. his wisdom cannot be measured. but crushes the wicked to the ground. play music on the harp to our God. he provides rain for the earth and makes grass grow on the hills. and feeds the young ravens when they call. nor his delight in brave soldiers; in those who trust in his constant love. Praise your God, O Zion! he blesses your people. and satisfies you with the finest wheat. and what he says is quickly done. and scatters frost like dust. no one can endure the cold he sends! he sends the wind, and the water flows. his instructions and laws to Israel. they do not know his laws. Praise the Lord !
The Lord is restoring Jerusalem;
He heals the broken-hearted
He has decided the number of the stars
Great and mighty is our Lord;
He raises the humble,
Sing hymns of praise to the Lord ;
He spreads clouds over the sky;
He gives animals their food
His pleasure is not in strong horses,
but he takes pleasure in those who honor him,
Praise the Lord , O Jerusalem!
He keeps your gates strong;
He keeps your borders safe
He gives a command to the earth,
He spreads snow like a blanket
He sends hail like gravel;
Then he gives a command, and the ice melts;
He gives his message to his people,
He has not done this for other nations;

148.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Praise the Lord from heaven, you that live in the heights above. all his heavenly armies. praise him, shining stars. He commanded, and they were created; sea monsters and all ocean depths; strong winds that obey his command. fruit trees and forests; reptiles and birds. princes and all other rulers; old people and children too. His name is greater than all others; his glory is above earth and heaven. so that all his people praise him— the people of Israel, so dear to him. Praise the Lord !
Praise him, highest heavens, and the waters above the sky. and they cannot disobey.
Let them all praise the name of the Lord !
by his command they were fixed in their places forever,
Praise the Lord from the earth,
lightning and hail, snow and clouds,
Praise him, kings and all peoples,
Let them all praise the name of the Lord !

149.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Sing a new song to the Lord ; praise him in the assembly of his faithful people! rejoice, people of Zion, because of your king! play drums and harps in praise of him. he honors the humble with victory. and sing joyfully all night long. with their sharp swords in their hands and to punish the peoples; their leaders in chains of iron; This is the victory of God's people. Praise the Lord !
Be glad, Israel, because of your Creator;
The Lord takes pleasure in his people;
Let God's people rejoice in their triumph
Let them shout aloud as they praise God,
to bind their kings in chains,
to punish the nations as God has commanded.

150.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Praise God in his Temple! Praise his strength in heaven! Praise his supreme greatness. Praise him with harps and lyres. Praise him with harps and flutes. Praise him with loud cymbals. Praise the Lord !
Praise him for the mighty things he has done.
Praise him with drums and dancing.
Praise the Lord , all living creatures!
